title: Sauve, Gard
data: Sauve (French pronunciation: [sov]; Occitan: Saves) is a commune in the Gard department in southern France. In the early-1990s, American underground comic artist Robert Crumb traded six of his sketchbooks for a townhouse in Sauve. The late drummer of the Rolling Stones, Charlie Watts (1941-2021) had an apartment in the town. Roger Katan, French-American architect, planner, sculptor, and activist, resides in the village.
